title: Chair, 1844
markings:
Mark: an imitation of a patent registration mark
Opinion: Elizabeth Aslin of Victoria and Albert Museum, 9 Feb. 1968, "at top, where there should be a class number, the letter "H" appears.  Other chairs with such fake registration marks exist."
Second mark under back of seat.
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Wiesenberger
description: Side chair, with vestigial arms molded in one piece with rounded back having rolled and scalloped edge; cabriole legs; slip seat (upholstered Dec. 1967).  Black ground with gilded rococo-revival designs, mother-of-pearl inlay: central motif- fountain, birds and butterfly.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chair, 1844.
1844. Papier-mâché, paint, gilding, mother-of-pearl, wood. Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Wiesenberger. 1967-66-1.
